entry.title: Binance Client Executives Kidnapped, Forced to Empty Crypto Wallets ‚Äî CZ Says Total Loss Was $12.5 Million
entry.summary:
Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ) has shared a story of how executives of a Binance client were abducted and forced to empty their crypto wallets. CZ detailed how the cryptocurrency exchange was able to track the transactions and freeze over 94% of the stolen funds.
CZ Shares Story of How Binance Freezes Stolen Funds
Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ) shared a story of how the crypto exchange froze stolen funds on social media platform X Friday. Noting that the event was real, he explained that executives of a client were abducted while on a business trip in Montenegro. Emphasizing that they were forced to empty their crypto wallets, CZ said the executives suffered a total loss of about $12.5 million.
Zhao detailed that Binance investigated the on-chain activities of the crypto transact‚Ä¶

JPMorgan: US Crypto Regulations Unlikely to Ease Despite SEC Legal Defeats
entry.summary:
Global investment bank JPMorgan has warned investors that U.S. crypto regulations are unlikely to ease, even though the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has lost several recent court cases against crypto firms. ‚ÄúIt is far from clear that the regulatory tightening of the crypto industry will lessen significantly going forward given how unregulated this industry is,‚Äù said JPMorgan‚Äôs analysts.
JPMorgan Sees Continued Crypto Regulatory Tightening
JPMorgan‚Äôs analysts explained in a note last week that cryptocurrency regulations in the U.S. are unlikely to ease even after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lost several legal battles against crypto firms.
Citing optimism in the crypto space regarding the approval of spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) by the SEC‚Ä¶

entry.title: South Korean Crypto Exchange Bithumb Eyes IPO in Move to Challenge Upbit‚Äôs Market Dominance
entry.summary:
Local reports suggest that Bithumb, a prominent crypto exchange in South Korea, is contemplating a public listing in 2025. Insider information indicates that Bithumb is considering a debut on Kosdaq and might transition to the Korea Exchange (KOSPI) platform in the future.
Bithumb Targets Kosdaq Listing; Chooses Samsung Securities as Its Fund Manager
According to Edaily, a South Korean news outlet, Bithumb could pursue an initial public offering (IPO) by 2025. Yoo Kyung Lim, a journalist, noted that the exchange‚Äôs potential IPO strategy is seen as an ambitious effort to surpass Upbit‚Äôs market supremacy.
Upbit currently holds an 85% share of South Korea‚Äôs cryptocurrency trading market. The briefing highlights Lee Jung-hoon‚Äôs comeback as the major stakeholder on Bithumb‚Äôs board, with a‚Ä¶

entry.title: New crypto threat: Hackers misuse Ethereum feature for fraud
What Is Behind 0x Protocol‚Äôs (ZRX) 238% Price Surge in 2 Months?
Bitcoin: Redefining Ownership
entry.summary:
This article is featured in Bitcoin Magazine‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Withdrawal Issue‚Äù. Click here to subscribe now. A PDF pamphlet of this article is available for download.
The traditional way in which our society constructs ownership is inefficient. The Uber-for-X model solves part of the problem by exploiting the unused value of some long-tail assets, but the reason behind the existence of such a huge volume of long-tail assets remains a puzzle. In this essay, I submit that they exist because our conception of ownership is outdated; I propose that individuals only need to own bitcoin. By doing so, we will embrace a full-scale sharing economy backed by Bitcoin, paving the way for a hyperbitcoinized civilization. Born and raised in China during a decade of ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum Transaction Fees Climb 219% in 3 Weeks as Onchain Crypto Transfers Become Pricier
entry.summary:
Over the last three weeks, the transaction costs for bitcoin (BTC) have climbed sharply, reaching a peak of $15 per transfer just three days ago. Similarly, the cost to transfer ethereum (ETH) has jumped significantly. In the span from October 22 to November 12, 2023, the average fee for ethereum transactions soared by 219%, increasing from $2.08 to $6.64 per transaction.
Ethereum Transfer Costs Escalate by 219% in Less Than a Month
The spike in ethereum (ETH) fees mirrors the uptrend seen in bitcoin‚Äôs transaction fees, as the expense associated with the gas required for transferring the digital currency has escalated in this period. At present, the average fee for an ether transaction stands at $6.64, with the median fee at 0.0013 ETH, or $2.70 per transaction.
Interestingly, the co‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Difficulty Hits Record 64.68 Trillion Amid 5 Straight Increases Since September
entry.summary:
On Sunday, November 12, 2023, Bitcoin‚Äôs difficulty metric climbed 3.55%, reaching a new peak of 64.68 trillion at block height 816,480. This adjustment marks the fifth consecutive rise in the network‚Äôs difficulty since September 19.
Bitcoin Difficulty Rises 3.55% Higher
The quest to discover a bitcoin (BTC) block reward has reached unprecedented difficulty following the latest adjustment at block height 816,480, which brought about a 3.55% increase. This hike follows a series of escalations, starting with a 5.48% rise on September 19, a slight 0.35% uptick on October 3, a significant 6.47% surge on October 16, and the 2.35% increase witnessed on October 29.
Currently, Bitcoin‚Äôs difficulty level has surpassed the 64 trillion mark, reflecting the daunting challenge and the intense c‚Ä¶

entry.title: Key Witness And Former FTX Execs Forge Ahead To Create New Crypto Exchange
entry.summary:
A group including former FTX executives, among whom is an individual who provided crucial testimony against Sam Bankman-Fried, has joined forces to establish a new cryptocurrency exchange. The primary objective of this venture is to address the challenges that led to the downfall of their previous employer.
Under the leadership of former FTX lawyer Can Sun, the Dubai-based startup Trek Labs has secured a license to provide cryptocurrency services in the region, granted in late October. The services will be offered under the name Backpack Exchange.
About $9 billion in customer deposits disappeared from FTX, and Sam Bankman-Fried, the company‚Äôs head, is now a convicted fraudster who might spend the rest of his life behind bars.
According to a report published on November 11 by the Wa‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Crypto Google Searches Surge, Peaking in October Before Tapering Off
entry.summary:
Over the 90-day stretch from August 13 to November 11, 2023, bitcoin (BTC) along with a broad array of crypto assets have posted substantial increases. Data from Google Trends in this timeframe indicates a surge in searches for ‚Äúbitcoin,‚Äù ‚Äúcrypto,‚Äù and ‚Äúethereum,‚Äù with these terms achieving a peak popularity score of 100 by late October.
Searches for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Crypto Hit Highs in October
Recently, the allure of the three terms has grown, yet post-October has seen a decline. Global data from Google Trends over the last 90 days reveals that the interest for ‚Äúcrypto‚Äù hit 77 out of a potential 100 on October 24. Advancing to October 30, the interest in ‚Äúcrypto‚Äù climaxed, scoring a perfect 100. As of November 11, the search interest for the term is maintaining a steady pace at ‚Ä¶

entry.title: NFT Boom: CryptoPunks Collection Shines With 900% Trading Volume Increase
entry.summary:
The non-fungible token (NFT) industry has predominantly experienced a decline in trading activity since the beginning of the year, but the market appears to be currently undergoing a noteworthy and positive transformation. Based on on-chain data, one of the major collections that seems to be leading this recent surge is the CryptoPunk non-fungible tokens.
CryptoPunks, a series of 10,000 unique pixel art characters on the Ethereum blockchain, gained widespread acclaim and fervent collector attention for a few years after its inception. However, interest in the collection has been relatively low in the past few months, coinciding with the widespread downturn in the NFT market.
Trading Volume Surge From $200,000 To $3,000,000 In One Week

entry.title: Hackers Exploit New Feature To Bypass Security Alerts ‚Äì Report
entry.summary:
In a concerning trend, hackers, specifically wallet drainers, have begun to leverage the CREATE2 opcode on the Ethereum network to sidestep security measures in select wallets. This development was revealed on Sunday via an X post by blockchain security company Scam Sniffer.¬†
Over $60 Million Lost To Hackers Via CREATE2 Exploit, Report Says
The CREATE2 opcode was designed to allow the prediction of a contract address before deployment. Most notably, it is used by prominent decentralized exchange Uniswap to facilitate the creation of pair contracts.¬†
However, using this feature, cybercriminals have found a way to bypass security checks in regard to investor wallets. Scam Sniffer explains that hackers use CREATE2 to effortlessly generate momentary new addresses, each with a malicious‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Bankruptcy Is Now One-Year Old ‚Äì How Has Solana (SOL) Fared Since Then?
entry.summary:
It‚Äôs hard to believe it‚Äôs been a whole year since the shocking collapse of crypto exchange FTX. A lot has changed in the crypto world since then, but most cryptocurrencies have been relatively less volatile since the whole debacle ended, save for the recent bull run in October.
Solana, one of the cryptocurrencies closely tied to FTX‚Äôs Sam Bankman Fried, took a major beating in the aftermath. But Solana has now regained its footing in the past month, as it finally starts to move beyond the FTX bankruptcy shadow.¬†
How Has Solana Fared Since FTX Bankruptcy?
FTX filed for bankruptcy in November 2022 following a protracted period of back and forths that rocked the cryptocurrency markets. Sam Bankman-Fried was a big supporter of Solana, backing projects in its ecosystem.
FTX also had‚Ä¶

entry.title: Onecoin ‚ÄòCompliance‚Äô Head Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud and Money Laundering Charges
entry.summary:
Irina Dilkinska, the head of legal and compliance at Onecoin, has pleaded guilty to ‚Äúwire fraud and money laundering charges.‚Äù The charges against Dilkinska relate to her role in organizing the transfer of $110 million in fraudulently obtained funds to a Cayman Islands entity.
The $110 Million Transfer to a Cayman Islands Entity
Irina Dilkinska, the one-time head of legal and compliance at Onecoin, has pleaded guilty to ‚Äúwire fraud and money laundering charges,‚Äù Damian Williams, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, has said. In a Nov. 9 press release, Williams said the charges against Dilkinska relate to her role in organizing the transfer of $110 million in fraudulently obtained funds to a Cayman Islands entity.

Near Foundation and Polygon Labs recently announced that they would build ‚Äúa zero-knowledge (ZK) prover for WASM blockchains.‚Äù For WASM chains using the zkWASM prover, settling transactions will be more efficient and cost-effective with maximum security guarantees.
Transaction Settling More Efficient and Cost-Effective
Near Foundation, the organization supporting the development of the NEAR ecosystem, has partnered with Polygon Labs to ‚Äúbuild a zero-knowledge (ZK) prover for Webassembly (WASM) blockchains or zkWASM for short.‚Äù According to a joint press release, the two entities‚Äô zkWASM prover, which is set to be launched in 2024, is positioned ‚Äúto lead the market among other wasm provers.‚Äù

entry.title: Shiba Inu Marketing Lead Reveals The Important Role Of SHIB In The Shibarium Ecosystem
entry.summary:
The Shiba Inu ecosystem has grown exponentially from its early days as a meme crypto inspired by a doge meme and created as the Dogecoin killer. Shiba Inu has now evolved to have its own layer-2 blockchain designed to process SHIB transactions quickly and smart contracts off-chain the Ethereum network.
The ecosystem is home to three tokens, SHIB, BONE, and LEASH, and a decentralized trading platform called ShibaSwap. Behind this growth is SHIB‚Äôs popularity, as the token is the foundation of the ecosystem.¬†
Lucie, Shiba Inu‚Äôs marketing lead, recently took to social media platform X, to reiterate SHIB‚Äôs position as Shibarium‚Äôs governance token while also highlighting some of its utilities.

entry.title: Bitstream White Paper Proposes Bitcoin Payments to Disrupt File Storage Economy
entry.summary:
Robin Linus, the creator behind BitVM ‚Äî a computing construct atop the Bitcoin blockchain ‚Äî released a new white paper on November 11, 2023, entitled ‚ÄúBitstream.‚Äù The document explores a system aimed at reforming the economic structure of file storage, suggesting a usage-based model that rewards server contributions with bitcoin payments.
Bitstream Revealed: A White Paper‚Äôs Bitcoin-Based Bid to Overhaul Data Hosting
The Bitstream white paper, authored by blockchain programmer Robin Linus, unveils a method where servers receive direct payments in bitcoin (BTC) for each file download they facilitate. Addressing the imbalance in current hosting economics, Linus‚Äô system aligns server profit with content demand.
Servers are compensated for providing a service to the network, namely the di‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Lawmaker: Crypto Is Not the Problem, Bad Actors That Exist in Every Industry Are
entry.summary:
U.S. Senator Cynthia Lummis has defended crypto against claims that the asset class is heavily used in illicit finance. Emphasizing that ‚ÄúCrypto is not the problem, bad actors that exist in every industry are,‚Äù the lawmaker pointed out that crypto accounts for less than 1% of all illicit finance activity. In addition, she has urged Congress to create a regulatory framework to allow crypto firms to operate in the U.S. instead of driving them to ‚Äúunregulated foreign markets.‚Äù
Lawmaker Says ‚ÄòCrypto Is Not the Problem‚Äô
U.S. Senator Cynthia Lummis (R-WY) defended crypto in response to an article on Forbes about how misinformation on Hamas and crypto fooled nearly 20% of Congress.
‚ÄúCrypto accounts for < 1% of all illicit finance activity and would be even less if we created a regulatory st‚Ä¶

Ripple‚Äôs CEO says the U.S. government is still hostile toward crypto despite the cryptocurrency firm‚Äôs victory against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). ‚ÄúUntil that changes, the banks in the United States are not going to engage meaningfully,‚Äù he warned, adding: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think the window has passed for the U.S. to be a leader. But I think every day that goes by, these other markets, they want the entrepreneurs there, they want growth.‚Äù
U.S. Government‚Äôs Crypto Stance
Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse discussed the U.S. government‚Äôs crypto stance at the DC Fintech Week conference on Wednesday. Ripple recently won several legal battles against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

entry.summary:
Steven Nerayoff, one of the earliest advisors for Ethereum, has had various debates and discussions concerning Ethereum in the past few weeks. The former lawyer for the crypto firm has never wavered from his position that Vitalik Buterin and Joseph Lubin, the co-founders of Ethereum, engaged in fraudulent activity during the early days of the network and that the SEC was corrupt in its dealings with Ethereum.

entry.summary: Valve's enhanced Steam Deck OLED upgrades the handheld gaming PC with a better screen, longer battery life, and other tweaks.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Andrew Hayward

entry.title: OneCoin Legal Chief Pleads Guilty to Role in Cryptoqueen's $4 Billion Fraud
entry.summary: Irina Dilkinska admitted in Manhattan federal court to helping launder $110 million in illicit profits generated through OneCoin.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Stacy Elliot

entry.title: Mois√©s Zamora on Videomart and Bucking the Hollywood System
entry.summary: "Selena: The Series" creator and co-showrunner Mois√©s Zamora joins Decrypt's Sander Lutz at the Film3 Summit 2023 to discuss why the Hollywood system is broken and why he founded the Videomart NFT digital film marketplace to give creators more power.

entry.title: You Can Now Lend Your NFTs to Gamers and Earn Passive Income
entry.summary: LootRush will let gamers list their NFTs for rent on its marketplace, allowing them to earn passive income for game items like cards and land.

entry.title: Why OTK Is Making Video Games
entry.summary: One True King (OTK) Chief Strategy Officer Zachary Diaz tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about OTK's long-term strategy and vision to become a content creator-powered media and video games company.

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: LoVid
entry.summary:
Artistic duo LoVid, aka Tali Hinkis and Kyle Lapidus, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer burning questions about art, lettuce, and the hellscape (in someone‚Äôs opinion) that is Miami.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: Barney on DeFi, Privacy, and Vega
entry.summary:
This week our host is joined by Barney the founder of Vega Protocol.
They discuss the current state of DeFi, what's wrong with the apps being built today, whether or not privacy matters when its only applied to an L2, and most importantly-- which form of sales tax is the sexiest.

entry.title: Why Is Phantom Galaxies Releasing Two Versions of Its Game?
entry.summary: Animoca Brands-owned Blowfish Studios is building a space mech pilot game called Phantom Galaxies. Blowfish Cofounder Ben Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his plans for the game's release.

entry.title: Sophie Maxx on NFTs, Augmented Reality, and Fashion
entry.summary: This week our host is joined by Sophie Maxx (Web3Maxx) to discuss NFTs, augmented reality, the metaverse, how blockchain is sneaking into the fashion world, and more!

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: Kevin Rose
entry.summary:
Kevin Rose, co-founder and CEO of PROOF and co-creator of the hit Moonbirds NFT collection, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer some hard-hitting questions about his childhood dreams, his wife‚Äôs candy preferences, and his undying love of rap music.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: What Happened to Atari's Token? Inside Atari's Blockchain Plans
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Atari X director Tyler Drewitz about what happened with Atari's token plans, whether a token is coming, and what Atari games might be getting the blockchain treatment. Oh, and there's lots of Easter eggs.

entry.title: Twitch CEO Dan Clancy Is a 'Wild Card,' Says Marketing Director
entry.summary: Twitch Senior Director of Community Marketing Mary Kish speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Twitch CEO Dan Clancy, Ninja, Twitch's new simulcasting rules, the biggest differences between Twitch and rival platform Kick, and the role of esports on the streaming platform.

entry.title: Why NFT Paris has Launched a Loyalty Token
entry.summary: NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov told Decrypt what to expect from the upcoming 2024 edition of the conference, the launch of its loyalty token and its plans to create a Web3 loyalty program that rewards the most engaged members of the community.

entry.title: Game Review‚ÄîFormula E: High Voltage Is a Fun Play-to-Earn Racer That Lacks Direction
entry.summary:
Formula E: High Voltage is a play-to-earn racing game with a distinctive strategic approach. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin put Animoca's web-based game through its paces in this review, highlighting the unique gameplay design, the role of NFTs and crypto, and where the game currently comes up short.

entry.title: Amanda Cassatt on Web3 Marketing and the early days of Ethereum
entry.summary:
In this week's episode, our host is joined by Amanda Cassatt!
Amanda is the founder of Serotonin, a web3 marketing agency, the author of the first book ever published on web3 marketing, and led the marketing team that helped bring Ethereum to market.

entry.title: Midnight Society's Rob Bowling on Deadrop's New Cars and User-Generated Modes
entry.summary: Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin interviews Midnight Society Studio Head Rob Bowling about Deadrop's development and Snapshot VII.

entry.title: Game Review: 'Raini: The Lords of Light' Brands Itself With Memes
entry.summary: Raini: Lords of Light is an NFT-optional card game bursting with crypto memes. From SBF to CZ and Elon, this free-to-play game has some truly wild animations. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares his honest thoughts on the game.

entry.title: Art Blocks Marfa Weekend Recap
entry.summary: Relive the Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023 event with this highlights video, produced by Vincent Roazzi Jr. for Decrypt Studios in partnership with Art Blocks.

entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: Clip: DeepMedia's DeepID Deepfake Detection Tool at Work
entry.summary: A clip showcasing how DeepMedia's DeepID deepfake detection tool works. Courtesy: DeepMedia

entry.title: Decentraland AI World Fair Trailer
entry.summary: A trailer for the AI World Fair event in metaverse game Decentraland, taking place from October 25-27. Courtesy: Decentraland.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.
Our Host: https://twitter.com/rezajafery Our Guest: https://twitter.com/BackTheBunny
